title: Interactive E-Book Utilization Language Learning Strategies in Remote Education Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, foundational grammar comprehension, and language learning experience
context.additional_context: Practitioners engage in asynchronous learning during work hours, with practical language application skills assessed through project deliverables (text/multimedia presentations)

learning_goals: Learners can navigate and utilize vocabulary and grammatical structures in language learning content at over 90% proficiency using hyperlinks and multimedia features within e-books.
Learners can perform reading-writing interactive learning activities based on peer feedback via e-book annotation and sharing features at over 80% proficiency.
Learners can specifically present and receive evaluations on practical language application cases (writing and presentation) through PBL outcomes based on e-books.

resources: Interactive E-Book Platform with Embedded Features

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
